intro: Senecio fanshawei, commonly known as the Shandong groundsels, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio fanshawei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and aesthetic appeal.
